input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: NIEGOWA MUNICIPALITY. Summary: Collection, Transport and Management of Municipal Waste from the Niegowa Commune. Description: The subject of the order is the collection, transport and management of municipal waste from properties located in the Niegowa Commune and from the selective municipal waste collection point (PSZOK). The task includes servicing single-family properties, multi-family properties, properties with summer houses and other properties used for recreational and leisure purposes, the building of the Niegowa Commune Office, a selective municipal waste collection point in the commune Niegowa. A detailed description of the subject of the order is included in Annex No. 2 to the SWZ, hereinafter referred to as OPZ, and the contract template - Annex No. 10 to the SWZ. The Ordering Party indicates that the minimum amount of services provided by the parties that will be entrusted to the Contractor on the basis of concluded agreement, will amount to no less than 80% of the estimated amount of waste expected to be collected and transported, where the planned amount of this waste over the entire duration of the agreement is estimated: 1) Unsegregated (mixed) municipal waste - 1040 Mg 2) Separately collected waste (plastics, metal, multi-material waste, glass, paper) - 610 Mg 3) Bio-waste -184 Mg 4) Ash - 762 Mg 5) Large dimensions -350 Mg 6) Tires 30 Mg 7) Renovation waste - 30 Mg 8) Waste electronics and household appliances - 6 Mg 9) Clothing i textiles - 10 Mg 10) Other collected in PSZOK - 4 Mg The contractor is obliged to collect and manage waste in a way that ensures that the commune fulfills its obligations imposed by the Act on maintaining cleanliness.... Lower Silesia. The order was divided into 3 separate procurement items. Items orders cannot be divided by Contractors, offers that do not include the full scope of the subject matter of the order specified in the partial task will be rejected. The scope of work includes, among others: a) Sorting (segregation) of waste, b) Loading onto trucks sorted waste, c) Transport of waste to the place of collection or processing, (d) In the case of hazardous waste, transfer to a final recovery process or final disposal process by the holder of the waste carrying out such process, e) Laying out the area after completing the works, f) Marking the area by placing information boards about the prohibition of dumping garbage. Additional obligations of the Contractor: a) taking over the area of illegal dumping sites. A building used to retain surface water and ground in swampy areas. The construction site is administered by the Strzelce Forest District and is developed for forest management purposes. A few kilometers away, the ditch flows through Natura2000 areas. Area of ​​the retention area: 6 ha, planned capacity of facilities/volume of retained water: 18,000 m3. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: STATE WATER HOLDING POLISH WATERS. Summary: "Maintenance of Water, Water Facilities and Regulatory Structures in the Area of ​​The Catchment Management Board in Gorzów Wielkopolski (Framework Agreement)". Description: 4.1 The subject of the order is the conclusion of framework agreements for the performance of maintenance works on streams, canals and reservoirs located in the area of ​​operation of the Catchment Management Board in Gorzów Wielkopolski in order to maintain and improve their technical efficiency. Works will include, among others: on mowing the slopes of streams, cutting out bushes, mechanical and manual hacking of the bottom, removing blockages, building bank holes, securing the banks and making bands from fascine pipes. The work will consist of the current one maintaining sections of natural streams and canals and water facilities flowing through the areas of the above-mentioned Water Supervision Authority. Carrying out the above works will help maintain the slopes and bottoms of watercourses in good technical condition and will contribute to ensuring proper conditions for the passage and regulation of water levels in the area of the Catchment Management Board in Gorzów Wielkopolski. Individual partial orders will include, among others: following leading works: - mowing and raking lichens from slopes and the bottom of the stream, removing them sheepskin coat from floating plants, removing blockages, dismantling beaver dams, removing bushes, cleaning culverts; manual and mechanical removal of plants rooting at the bottom of the stream, spreading of organic matter, removal of debris and dams, local narrowings of the riverbed, etc.; repair of riverbed insurance and development of bank breaches; removing natural threats to people and property. 4.2 Detailed scope and type of work to be performed in.... Published Date: 2025-12-22. Closing Date: 2026-01-22. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: STATE TREASURY STATE FOREST HOLDING, STATE FORESTS, WIEDZY BRÓD FOREST DISTRICT. Summary: "Service of Inventory of Leks, Monitoring the Population Size of the Capercaillie Tetrao Urogallus, Collecting Samples for Research in the Augustów Forest in 2026, Together with Preparing a Report, Carried out as Part of the Project.... Description: "Service of inventory of leks, monitoring the population size of the capercaillie Tetrao urogallus, collecting samples for research in the Augustów Forest in 2026, together with preparing a report, carried out as part of the project... Material scope of the subject of the order: Purpose of the work covered by the order is to learn the range of the capercaillie and the number of birds occurring naturally in the Augustów Forest and to collect available samples in the field for testing: capercaillie feathers, excrements. The abundance estimation method is used birds using sound recorders. This is a non-invasive method and does not require excessive penetration of the lek area. Direct observations will be an auxiliary method. As part of the order, location and inventory will be carried out leks using sound recorders recording the voices of mating males and females. Additionally, direct observations will be carried out and information about observations from the field will also be collected from forest services and forest workers. The contractor will collect samples - excrement, capercaillie feathers. The results of the order execution will be presented in the report (paper version and digital version on CD/DVD). The number of leks within 4 forest districts, i.e. Wiedzy Bród, Augustów, Pomorze and Płaska is estimated at 14 leks, including active and abandoned ones, identified over the last 16 years. The detailed Order Description is attached as Annex No. 2 to the SWZ "Service of inventory of lekking grounds and monitoring the population size of the Tetrao capercaillie urogallus, a collection of samples for research in the Augustowska Forest in 2026, together with the preparation of a report, carried out as part of the project "Together for Nature - species protection.... Published Date: 2025-12-22. Closing Date: 2026-01-26. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: REGIONAL DIRECTORATE FOR ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION IN KRAKOW. Summary: Conducting Protective Activities in Xerothermic Habitats in 2 Natura 2000 Areas in the Miechowska Upland - Procedure Iv.. Description: I. 1..1.1.1. The subject of the order is to carry out protective activities in xerothermic habitats in 2 Natura 2000 areas in the Miechowska Upland - Cybowa Góra, Giebułtów. 2. The aim of the action is to improve the structure of the habitat and provide appropriate conditions for xerothermic species, by limiting natural succession and eliminating weevils lying on the surface of the habitat. 3. Protective actions will consist of: a) mowing patches of xerothermic grasslands b) ringing trees c)plucking shrubs and tree saplings up to 2 m high d) collection and utilization of biomass 2. Details of the scope of the subject of this order (including a detailed description of how to complete the task, intermediate deadlines) and maps with marked treatment areas - can be found in Annex No. 9 to SWZ - Description of the Subject of the Order (OPZ). 3. 3. Ordering Party - pursuant to Art. 95 section 1 of the Act - requires the Contractor or subcontractor to employ, under an employment relationship, persons directed by the Contractor or subcontractor to perform activities involving physical work, such as cutting, collecting and transporting biomass, if the performance of these activities involves performing work in the manner specified in Art. 22 § 1 of the Act of June 26, 1974, Labor Code 3.4 Ordering Party reserves the right to invalidate these proceedings pursuant to Art. 257 of the Public Procurement Law, if the funds he intended to allocate for the implementation of the order are not granted to him in whole or in part.... input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: STATE WATER HOLDING POLISH WATERS. Summary: Maintenance, Maintenance and Drainage Works of Rivers in the Area of ​​The Sieradz Catchment Management Board - Framework Agreement. Description: 1. The purpose of the procedure is to conclude a framework agreement between the Ordering Party and a maximum of eight Contractors for a given part of the order, in order to determine the terms of orders that may be awarded within a period of up to 36 months from the date of signing. contracts. The Framework Agreement is valid from the date of signing the Framework Agreement by the Parties, for a period of 36 months, but no longer than until December 31, 2028 or until the completion of Works with a value equal to the gross amount specified in § 9 section 2 Agreements Framework. 2. The works will consist in the ongoing maintenance of sections of natural watercourses, canals and water facilities flowing through the areas of the Water Supervision Authority under the Catchment Management Board in Sieradz. Performing the above works will allow you to maintain good health technical condition of slopes and the bottom of watercourses will contribute to ensuring proper conditions for the passage and regulation of water levels. 3. Pursuant to Art. 7 point 26 of the Public Procurement Law, a framework agreement - should be understood as an agreement concluded between the Ordering Party and one or a larger number of Contractors, the purpose of which is to establish the conditions regarding orders that may be awarded in a given period, in particular prices and, if necessary, expected quantities. 4. Scope and type of work to be performed as part of the subject of the order for individual parts, it was included in the annexes: - Description of the subject of the order - Annex No. 3 to the SWZ, - Bills of quantities - Annex No. 3 to the SWZ, - Template of the framework agreement - attached.... Description: The subject of the contract is the provision of services consisting in the collection and management of separately collected municipal waste and mixed waste from real estate where residents live and from real estate where there are: cottages holiday homes or other properties used for recreational purposes, used only for part of the year. Approximate amounts of individual types of waste are included in the unit price form constituting Annex 2 to the Specification Order Terms. The total estimated amount of waste is: 19,010 Mg. The detailed scope of the order includes: 1) Collection and management of municipal waste from inhabited properties according to the implementation schedule, 2) Collection and management of waste from PSZOK in Koluszki, 3) Preparing monthly reports to monitor the services provided and inform the Ordering Party about any: problems and irregularities noticed during the provision of municipal waste collection services, 4) Preparing and submitting annual reports to the Ordering Party in accordance with Chapter 4b of the Act of September 13, 1996 on maintaining cleanliness and order in municipalities (consolidated text: Journal of Laws of 2023, item 1469). Summary: Framework Agreement - Maintenance of Natural Watercourses and Water Facilities in the Area of ​​Operation of Pgw Wody Polskie of the Stargard Catchment Management Board.. Description: The subject of this order is the conclusion of a framework agreement on the basis of which orders will be awarded for maintenance works on natural streams, canals and water facilities as well as acceptance of works in order to restore good condition technical and ensuring the free flow of water in the riverbeds in a way that minimizes the negative impact of the works on the environment, in the area of ​​the Water Supervision Authority: Choszczno, Goleniów, Pyrzyce and Stargard, which are administered by the Catchment Management Board in Stargard. The order was divided by the Ordering Party into 4 parts. The purpose of this procedure is to conclude 4 framework agreements, one for each part of the procedure, between the Ordering Party and a maximum of ten Contractors. for each part, in order to determine the terms of orders that may be awarded within a period of up to 24 months from the date of conclusion of the framework agreement, hereinafter referred to as "partial orders". The indicated quantities (measurements) in the "Price Lists" are of a size nature indicative. Pursuant to the provisions of the Public Procurement Law, the framework agreement does not constitute an obligation of the Ordering Party to award any future orders on its basis. A detailed description of the subject of the order for a given part of the order is included in Annex No. 1 to SWZ. Part 1 - NW Choszczno Choszczno Water Supervision - maintenance works involving the maintenance of natural watercourses and water facilities. A detailed description of the subject of the order for a given part of the order is included in Appendix No. 1 to the SWZ. .... Published Date: 2025-12-19. Closing Date: 2026-01-19. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

The purpose of carrying out this procedure is to conclude 5 framework agreements, one for each part of the procedure, between the Ordering Party and a maximum of ten (10) Contractors for each part, in order to establish the terms of orders that may be awarded during the period of validity framework agreement. The indicated quantities (quantities) in the "Price Lists" constituting Annexes to the SWZ are indicative quantities. The Ordering Party reserves the right not to use the full quantitative scope of the framework agreement, i.e. not to award orders partial in these amounts or exceeding these quantities in the event of failure to use the amount allocated for the implementation of framework agreements, and the Contractors are not entitled to any claims in this respect. The works will consist in ongoing water maintenance, i.e. sections of natural streams and canals, water facilities in the areas of Water Supervision (parts 1 - 5), in accordance with the meaning of the obligations in Art. 227 of the Water Law (Journal of Laws 2025, item 960). Carrying out the above work will help keep it in good technical condition slopes and bottoms of watercourses, will contribute to ensuring proper conditions for the passage and regulation of water levels in the riverbeds, maintaining them in proper technical condition, ensuring proper protection against floods.... input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: STATE WATER HOLDING POLISH WATERS. Summary: Maintenance of Water and Water Facilities as Well as other Facilities Related to Water Management in the Area of ​​The Catchment Management Board in Gdańsk. Description: 1.The subject of the order is a service called Maintenance of water and water facilities as well as other facilities related to water management in the area of ​​the Catchment Management Board in Gdańsk. These proceedings are being conducted for the purpose of concluding framework agreements. Subject of the order was divided into nine parts. For each of these parts, the Ordering Party envisages concluding framework agreements with a maximum of five Contractors. The framework agreement is not a public procurement agreement but only a basis for awarding orders individual (executive) works covered by this agreement. The conclusion of a framework agreement does not oblige the Ordering Party to award an executive order to a given Contractor. The procedure for awarding executive orders is regulated by a framework agreement, the template of which is Annex 8 to the SWZ - Draft Provisions of the Framework Agreement (PPUR). 2. The Ordering Party allows the submission of partial offers. The order consists of the following parts: -Part 1: Maintenance of channels in the area of the Water Supervision in Gdańsk; -Part 2: Maintenance of watercourses and canals area of ​​the Water Supervision Authority in Gdynia; -Part 3: Maintenance of watercourses in the area of ​​the Water Supervision in Kartuzy; -Part 4: Maintenance of watercourses in the area of ​​the Water Supervision in Bytów; -Part 5: Maintenance of watercourses and canals in the area of ​​the Water Supervision in Lębork; -Part 6: Maintenance of watercourses and canals in the area of ​​the Water Supervision Authority in Pruszcz Gdański; -Part 7: Maintenance of watercourses and canals in the area of ​​the Water Supervision in Puck; -Part 8: Maintenance of watercourses and canals in the area of ​​the Water Supervision in Reda;.... No. 59, item 366). COLLECTION AND HANDLING MUNICIPAL WASTE FROM RESIDENTIAL PROPERTIES IN THE MUNICIPALITY OF SZYDŁOWO The subject of the order is the collection and management of municipal waste from real estate inhabited in the Szydłowo commune in the period from the date of signing contract until December 31, 2026. The scope of the subject of the order includes in particular: 1) collection and management of all municipal waste from property owners living in the Szydłowo Commune, 2) providing property owners with inhabited waste bags collected selectively. Description: The subject of the order is the service of providing investor supervision over the implementation of design works and works, as well as managing the Contract entitled: "Construction and expansion of acoustic screens along the A1 section, Łódź Północ junction - Łódź Południe junction". Service supervision will be carried out in the following areas: Services management and supervision during the design period (Stage I Agreements with the contractor of design works and works), Management and supervision services during the implementation of works construction (Stage II of the Agreement with contractor of design works and works) and Management and supervision services during the testing and measurement period (Stage III of the Agreement with the contractor design works and works). Stage III of the Agreement with the contractor of design works and works provides that the Supervision will verify the tests and analyzes included in the contractor's report documentation and works regarding measurements performed using the procedure of continuous 24-hour noise level recording. The Investor's Supervision will accept the completed design and construction works studies on noise level tests, issued Partial Acceptance Protocols and other Acceptance Protocols, prepared Settlement Tables for the Contractor of design works and works, verified and accepted the Basic Bill of Quantities of Permanent Works, the Work Schedule Design and Construction Works, cooperated at every stage of the task implementation with the Investor and the Contractor of design works and works. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: MUNICIPAL BUDGET OFFICE IN KROCZYCE. Summary: Collection, Transport and Management of Stabilized Municipal Sewage Sludge, Screenings and Sand Trap from the Sewage Treatment Plant in Kostkowice for 2026. Description: The subject of the order is the collection, transport and management of stabilized municipal sewage sludge code 19 08 05, screenings code 19 08 01 and the contents of sand trap code 19 08 02 generated at the sewage treatment plant in Kostkowice. The amount of sludge expected by the Ordering Party, which is the subject of the order, is approximately 400 Mg for the sludge, 10 Mg for the screenings and 6 Mg for the sand trap content. The quantity given is an estimate and may change. The Ordering Party reserves the right increasing or reducing the amount of waste transferred. If municipal waste is collected from the cleaning plant in an amount smaller than that specified above, the Contractor is not entitled to claim compensation from the Ordering Party in this respect. Notwithstanding the above The contractor will be entitled to remuneration only for the amount of waste actually collected. The management of stabilized sewage sludge should be carried out in accordance with the principles of waste treatment specified in the applicable regulations, the Act of December 14 2012 on waste (consolidated text: Journal of Laws of 2023, item 1587), excluding Art. 96 of the Act, the Ordering Party does not allow the use of stabilization.... Published Date: 2025-12-13. Closing Date: 2025-12-22. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: KOCK COMMUNE. Summary: Collection of Municipal Waste from Property Owners in the Kock Commune. Description: 1) The subject of the order is the collection of municipal waste from property owners residing and uninhabited in the Kock commune and the delivery of bags and containers for collecting waste during the term of the contract. The Kock commune has approximately 6,000 inhabitants, a total of approximately 2,100 households and uninhabited properties in the city and 14 towns (collection of municipal waste from residential and uninhabited properties can take place simultaneously). Waste collection, disposal and management should take place in accordance with the guidelines of the Waste Management Plan for the Lublin Voivodeship 2028 and other applicable provisions of Polish law, based on the schedule agreed with the Ordering Party and provided by the Contractor in writing to the property owners, with from which waste will be collected. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: REGIONAL WASTE MANAGEMENT PLANT SP. Z O. O.. Summary: Collection, Transport and Management of Large-Sized Waste Code 20 03 07. Description: The subject of the order is the successive collection, transport and management of large-size waste with code 20 03 07, originating from collections from municipalities supplying waste to the installation in a maximum amount of 1,300 Mg throughout the duration of the contract. The minimum amount of waste ready for transfer will be 400 Mg. The actual amount of waste will result from the current needs of the Ordering Party. We estimate that the bulk loading density will be between 0.12Mg-0.19Mg/m3. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: CHIEF INSPECTORATE OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION. Summary: Monitoring of Bottom Sediments of Rivers and Lakes in 2026.. Description: The purpose of the order "Monitoring bottom sediments of rivers and lakes in 2025" is to update knowledge about the chemical state of bottom sediments of rivers and lakes, necessary for water management in river basin areas, in particular to protect water against pollution resulting from human activities. The project is mainly aimed at controlling the concentrations of heavy metals and persistent organic pollutants, including priority substances in the field of water policy, monitored to determining trends in changes in the concentrations of pollutants accumulating in bottom sediments. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: OŻAROWICE MUNICIPALITY. Summary: Collection and Management of Municipal Waste from Residential Properties in the Ożarowice Commune in 2026-2028. Description: 1) Order called "Collection and management of municipal waste from residential properties in the Ożarowice Commune in 2026-2028" includes: a) Collection and management of unsegregated (mixed) and separated municipal waste from residential properties located in the Ożarowice Commune, excluding waste related to running a business. b) Collection and management of municipal waste segregated from a selective municipal waste collection point. c) Equipping the property with containers with a capacity of 120 l, 240 l for collecting unsegregated (mixed) waste and in containers with a capacity of 120 l, 240 l and/or bags for selective waste collection. d) Equipment for the selective collection point for municipal waste in containers with capacity 120 l, 1100 l and containers with a capacity of 3 m3, 7 m3 for collecting municipal waste. e) Organizing at least once a year the collection of bulky waste in designated places for a given village in the form of an "action" or a tour of the entire area municipalities with waste collection from outside the property. f) Organizing a collection of textiles and clothing at least once a year, in the form of a tour of the entire commune with waste collection from outside the property. g) Organizing and conducting ecological education in institutions educational. 2) The estimated amount of waste is 7505 Mg and 10% under the option law. Summary: Maintenance of Water and Water Facilities as Well as other Facilities Related to Water Management in the Area of ​​The Catchment Management Board in Tczew. Description: 1.The subject of the order is a service called Maintenance of water and water facilities as well as other facilities related to water management in the area of ​​the Catchment Management Board in Tczew. These proceedings are being conducted for the purpose of concluding framework agreements. Subject of the order was divided into seven parts. For each of these parts, the Ordering Party envisages concluding framework agreements with a maximum of ten Contractors. The framework agreement is not a public procurement agreement but only a basis for awarding orders individual (executive) works covered by this agreement. The conclusion of a framework agreement does not oblige the Ordering Party to award an executive order to a given Contractor. The procedure for awarding executive orders is regulated by a framework agreement, the template of which is Annex 8 to the SWZ - Draft Provisions of the Framework Agreement (PPUR). 2. The Ordering Party allows the submission of partial offers. The order consists of the following parts: -Part 1: Maintenance of watercourses in the area of the Water Supervision in Grudziądz; -Part 2: Maintenance of watercourses on the site Water Supervision in Iława; -Part 3: Maintenance of watercourses in the area of ​​the Water Supervision in Kościerzyna; -Part 4: Maintenance of watercourses in the area of the Water Supervision in Kwidzyn, -Part 5: Maintenance of watercourses in the area of the Water Supervision in Starogard Gdański, -Part 6: Maintenance of watercourses in the area of the Water Supervision Authority in Tczew, -Part 7: Maintenance of watercourses in the area of the Water Supervision in Wąbrzeźno. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: NIEBYLEC COMMUNE. Summary: Collection, Transport and Management of Municipal Waste from Property Owners Residing in the Niebylec Commune in 2026-2027. Description: The subject of the order is a service consisting in the collection and transport of municipal waste from property owners residing in the Niebylec Commune, as well as from the Selective Municipal Waste Collection Point and the management of this waste in in the period from January 2, 2026 to December 31, 2027. The estimated amount of municipal waste to be collected under the order is 2,643.0 Mg. The order also includes the delivery of waste bags, approximately 593,900 pcs. Together with labels for the bags in the form of a code barcode, identifying each inhabited property. The scope of the order covers 11 villages: Baryczka, Blizianka, Gwoździanka, Gwoźnica Dolna, Gwoźnica Górna, Jawornik, Konieczkowa, Małówka, Niebylec, Lutcza and Połomia. Number of inhabitants from whom municipal waste will be collected is 8,725 people, and the Ordering Party reserves that this number may change during the duration of the subject of the order, depending on the submitted declarations on the amount of the fee for municipal waste management by owners of residential properties. The scope of the order includes in particular the collection and management of: 1) unsegregated (mixed) municipal waste in an amount of approximately 1,100.0 Mg, 2) separated municipal waste of the following types in quantities of approximately 1,021.6 Mg, including: a) paper (including cardboard, paper packaging waste and cardboard packaging waste), b) metals and plastics (including metal packaging waste, plastic packaging waste.... The task includes servicing single-family properties, multi-family properties, properties with summer houses and other properties used for recreational and leisure purposes, the building of the Niegowa Commune Office, a selective municipal waste collection point in the commune Niegowa. A detailed description of the subject of the order is included in Annex No. 2 to the SWZ, hereinafter referred to as OPZ, and the contract template - Annex No. 10 to the SWZ. Description: 4.1 The project titled The development of the Municipal Climate Change Adaptation Plan for the City of Otwock aims to create a comprehensive strategic document that will define actions and solutions enabling the city's adaptation to the effects of climate change. There will be a document takes into account the specificity of local environmental, social and economic conditions, as well as applicable national and international regulations and strategies. The scope of the document will be consistent with the provisions of the Act of April 27, 2001, Environmental Protection Law after the amendment of 2024, as well as with the guidelines for cities developed, among others, by the Institute of Environmental Protection, National Research Institute. The Municipal Climate Change Adaptation Plan will be prepared in accordance with the Adaptation Manual for Cities, guidelines for municipal preparation Climate change adaptation plan. The contractor will be obliged to have experts participate in committee meetings and sessions of the City Council when presenting the document and processing the resolution. The full completion of the subject of the order is the Municipal Adaptation Plan adopted by the Council resolution of the City of Otwock after completing the required Strategic Environmental Impact Assessment procedure.4.2 MPA b.... Published Date: 2025-12-11. Closing Date: 2025-12-18. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: GALEWICE COMMUNE. Summary: "Collection, Transport and Management of Waste from Sewage Treatment Plants in Galewice and Węglewice". Description: The subject of the order is the collection, transport and management of waste from sewage treatment plants in Galewice and Wglewice. The scope of the order includes collection, transport and management of: a) municipal sewage sludge code 19 08 05 in the amount of 480 Mg/year b) cuttings code 19 08 01 in quantity 30 Mg/yearc) sand with code 19 08 02 in the quantity 10 Mg/year In accordance with the requirements specified in the provisions of the Waste Act of December 14, 2012. (consolidated text: Journal of Laws of 2023, item 1587, as amended), Regulation of the Minister of the Environment of February 6, 2015 on the use of municipal sewage sludge (consolidated text: Journal of Laws of 2023, item 23) and other related implementing acts.2. Description: 1. The subject of the order is winter maintenance of roads, hereinafter referred to as ZUD, the purpose of which is to ensure passability and limit disruptions to road traffic flow caused by phenomena such as snowfall and sleet. 2. The approximate number of reference days in the season is 15.3. Subject of the contract there will be winter maintenance of roads, squares and sidewalks by shoveling and sprinkling a mixture of sand and salt using our own transport, equipment and materials. The service is intended to remove snow from the road and accompanying facilities such as bus bays, parking lots, squares and sidewalks. Responsible for the ZUD Contractor especially in the morning, it is necessary to ensure continuous traffic on those roads where there is daily traffic of vehicles transporting children and young people to educational institutions. Services will be provided based on the needs resulting from excavation, sprinkling depending on the prevailing weather conditions with the required response time, appendix no. 1, reference 1, and maintenance of sidewalks and parking lots until 6 a.m., other areas until 8 a.m. providing services with snow-removing equipment, i.e. asphalt roads on the width of the road, and in the case of drg.... output.Summary: Winter Maintenance of Municipal Roads and Streets in 2026
output.Description: The scope of the order includes: a) on-duty duties from 4 p.m. to 7 a.m. on working days and from 7 a.m. to 7 a.m. the following day on non-working days, b) mechanical removal and removal of the effects of black ice, i.e. removal of snow, snowdrifts and snow mud from streets, parking bays and parking lots on a hardened surface and combating winter slippage by sprinkling a mixture of sand and salt. The sand and salt mixture is provided by the Contractor. To make the sand and salt mixture, use: - 25% non-caking road salt meeting the requirements specified in the PN-86/C-84081/02-Sl standard (sodium chloride) and related standards, approved by a road laboratory and the Environmental Protection Inspector, - 75% of cracked sand with a grain size of 0.1 to 1.0 mm, in accordance with the Regulation of the Minister of the Environment of October 27, 2005 on the types and conditions of use of products that may be used on public roads and streets and squares (Journal of Laws No. 230, item 1960), c) delivery of a mixture of sand and salt to 5 containers located in the city and commune and their ongoing refilling (from the place indicated by the Ordering Party) at the request of the representative The order,d…
